alert.note: Alert for Brown (South Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Aberdeen (Northern and Northeastern South Dakota)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 05 at 10:43AM MDT until further notice by NWS Aberdeen
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in South Dakota... James River At Columbia affecting Brown County. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and major flooding is forecast. * WHERE...James River At Columbia. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 18.0 feet, 117th St between 395th and 400th Ave is flooded * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:15 AM CDT Thursday the stage was 17.8 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 11:15 AM CDT Thursday was 17.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 17.9 feet this evening. It will then rise to 18.2 feet next Thursday morning. Additional rises are possible thereafter. - Flood stage is 13.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/abr. The next statement will be issued by 745 PM CDT Friday evening.
